intro: Oenanthe fistulosa, commonly known as the common cow-weed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist meadows, riverbanks, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with serrated edges, and its flowers are white or pale green, appearing in clusters. Oenanthe fistulosa is known for its medicinal properties and has been used historically in herbal remedies.
